ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: score on children's global assessment scale
Is the participant a control?  0 = no; 1 = yes
"if the participant is a control, does he/she have a relative diagnosed with ASD?  0 = no; 1 = yes"

"if the participant has a relative diagnosed with ASD, specify the relationship to the affected person 0=mother; 1=father; 2=sister; 3=brother; 4=uncle; 5=aunt; 6=cousin; 7=grandmother; 8=grandfather"
Notes: 0 = Mother; 1 = Father; 2 = Sister; 3 = Brother; 4 = Uncle; 5 = Aunt; 6 = Cousin; 7 = Grandmother; 8 = Grandfather

ElementDescription: does participant have a subthreshold disorder other than adhd?True=1;False=0
does participant have subthreshold adhd?True=1;False=0
does participant have adhd? 1 = does participant have adhd? 1 = ADHD-Innatentive; 2=ADHD-Hyperactive/Impulsive; 3=ADHD-Combined; 4=ADHD-NOS; 5=rule out ADHD
Notes: 1 = ADHD-Innatentive; 2 = ADHD-Hyperactive/Impulsive; 3 = ADHD-Combined; 4 = ADHD-NOS; 5 = Rule out ADHD

ElementDescription: Number of hyperactive/impulsive symptoms endorsed at 2 in summary on KSADS
Number of hyperactive/impulsive symptoms endorsed at 3 in summary on KSADS
Number of inattentive symptoms endorsed at 2 in summary on KSADS
Number of inattentive symptoms endorsed at 3 in summary on KSADS
does participant have pdd? 1=PDD; 2=Aspergers; 3=Autism; 5=rule out PDD
Notes: 1 = PDD; 2 = Aspergers; 3 = Autism; 5 = Rule out PDD

ElementDescription: is there adhd/pdd comorbidity? i.e. participant meets DSM-IV PDD criteria and all DSM-IV ADHD criteria except for criterion E? 1 - yes; 2 - no
if pdd does participant meet for any DSM-IV ADHD diagnosis ignoring criterion E?  1 = ADHD-Innatentive; 2=ADHD-Hyperactive/Impulsive; 3=ADHD-Combined; 4=ADHD-NOS
does participant meet for Anxiety NOS? 1 = no; 1 = yes
current diagnosis of social phobia.
Notes: 0 = No information; 1 = Not present; 2 = Probable; 4 = Partial remission; 3 = Definite

Endorsed: Check all inattention symptoms listed in report
Notes: 1= often fails to give close attention to details; 2= often has difficulty sustaining attention; 3= often does not seem to listen; 4= often does not follow through on instructions; 5= often has difficulty organizing; 6= ofen avoids= dislikes; 7= often loses things; 8= is often easily distracted; 9= is often forgetful

ElementDescription: Endorsed: Check all hyperactivity-impulsivity symptoms listed in report
Notes: 1= often fidgets; 2= often leaves seat; 3= often runs about; 4= often has difficulty playing quietly; 5= is often 'on the go'; 6= often talks excessively; 7= often blurts out answers; 8= often has difficulty waiting turn; 9= often interrupts

ElementDescription: Some hyperactive-impulsive or inattentive symptoms that caused impairment were present before age 7 years
